ppe_requirements.respiratory: SCBA for >5% (50,000 ppm) or oxygen-deficient atmospheres. Not required for normal ambient levels.
ppe_requirements.skin: Insulated gloves for liquid/solid CO2 (dry ice) - cryogenic hazard. No protection needed for gas at normal levels.
ppe_requirements.eye: Safety glasses for dry ice handling. No protection needed for gas.
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level D for normal operations, Level B for confined spaces or high concentrations
ppe_requirements.special_notes: Simple asphyxiant - displaces oxygen. Heavier than air - accumulates in low areas. Dry ice causes frostbite. Physiological effects >1% concentration.

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Non-flammable. Used as fire suppressant. Cylinders may explode when heated.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Not applicable. CO2 extinguishes fires. If cylinder in fire, cool with water spray from maximum distance or evacuate - explosion hazard.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: Liquid/dry ice release: Ventilate area immediately. Evacuate low-lying areas - CO2 heavier than air. Monitor oxygen levels. Do not touch dry ice - frostbite.
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove to fresh air immediately. If not breathing, give artificial respiration. Administer 100% oxygen. Seek medical attention if symptoms persist. For dry ice contact: treat as frostbite - warm affected area gradually.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Greenhouse gas. Contributes to ocean acidification. Generally non-toxic to wildlife at normal atmospheric levels.
emergency_response.special_hazards: SIMPLE ASPHYXIANT - displaces oxygen. Heavier than air - accumulates in pits, tanks, confined spaces. Physiological effects: >1% increased respiration, >5% headache/dizziness, >10% unconsciousness, >20-30% death. ODORLESS - no warning. Dry ice causes severe frostbite.

storage_requirements.temperature_range: Store cylinders <52°C. Dry ice requires insulated storage <-78°C.
storage_requirements.ventilation: Good ventilation essential. Outdoor storage preferred for large quantities. Monitor oxygen levels in storage areas.
storage_requirements.container_material: Steel cylinders for compressed gas. Insulated containers for dry ice.
storage_requirements.segregation: None required. Keep away from reactive metals.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: Cylinders per fire code. Dry ice quantities limited by storage capacity.
storage_requirements.special_requirements: Cylinder restraints mandatory. Oxygen monitoring in storage areas. Post "SIMPLE ASPHYXIANT" signs. Adequate ventilation critical. Never store in confined spaces without ventilation and O2 monitoring.

hazardous_decomposition: Carbon monoxide (only at very high temperatures)
reactivity.reactivity_hazard: Generally non-reactive. Reacts with strong bases. May react with reactive metals. Solid CO2 causes embrittlement of some materials.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Low direct toxicity. LC50 (fish): >100 mg/L. Acidifies water (forms carbonic acid). High levels suffocate aquatic life.
environmental_impact.biodegradability: Not applicable (natural component of carbon cycle).
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: High mobility as gas. Absorbed by alkaline soils forming carbonates.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Major greenhouse gas. Atmospheric residence: 30-95 years. Essential for photosynthesis. Removed by plants and ocean absorption.

detection_monitoring.odor_threshold: Not applicable - odorless at all concentrations. No warning property. MUST use instruments.
